comment: Love Dr. Spoletini.  I learned so much.  She covered every aspect of the topic I could imagine.  Clear, easy to understand and fun.  She covered the tough topics, too.  Assignments were adjusted to class interests and appropriate.  I don't know if she was an easy grader because I was motivated to do the best I could regardless of grade.

Paola is a very fun teacher, but way overcomplicates the content. She's usually in her office during posted hours, and is always willing to help you with an assignment. Wants students to do well. The only issue I had was that we didn't know any of our grades; she just emailed us if we had an A, B, C or whatever at the end of the semester.

Dr. Paola Spoletini is a great professor. Her lectures are interesting to follow and she makes them fun to attend. Through her thorough knowledge and examples you learn a lot. If you put in the effort you will receive results. She is very approachable and caring.

Prof. Spoletini's lectures are ok at best, but she often cancels class. She does not grade anything until the last week, and your final grade is based upon the few items she manages to grade. The topics she chooses to include in her curriculum are somewhat interesting, but most of them will not help you get a job. Easy A, but not worth the money.

Few professors in KSU are as inspiration and qualified as Dr. Spoletini. She cares about every student which is why I prefer to take her class anytime its offered. Even though she is not very keen on grading most of her assignments are interesting, so you'll like to do them anyway. If you get stuck she is always available to answer your questions.

What some people fail to recognize about Paola is that the settled science on learning outcomes maps well to her teaching approach. Other professors show up and read slides, she actually cares about the experience you carry into your career. This platform is like yelp only more off-putting. Most of the feedback given here is clown shoes...

Nice teacher, but always finds a way to overcomplicate the class and make it WAY more difficult than it needs to be. I've had her in a few classes (not by choice) and it's the same style over and over. She teaches the easier classes, but then makes them into THEE hardest classes ever, unnecessarily. Doesnt respond to emails she doesnt like either.

Loved her class, her lectures are fun, casual and entertaining. Assigns a lot of homework and is a strict grader (which I don't mind for 1 second). Provides great feedback to students and asks for feedback from students to improve her lectures. She gives it her all. Overall a great professor if you are dedicated and actually want to learn.

Although the subject matter is not difficult, she managed to make the class difficult with loads of project work, homeworks, and participation work (discussions, group work, quizzes, etc.) that made the class a pill, especially if you are taking other involved classes. Bottom line: she seems easy, but be prepared for a load of work.

Paola was excellent. Her class was hard but she made it fun--and she taught it in a way that we would actually learn something. The one downside was that the main part of the class is a huge group project -- which can be stressful. The tests are also 100% written, but to me were fairly easy. She also leads research studies, which is great.

Pretty easy homeworks require a minimal effort like you can get a good grade with just being straight forward with no fluff. The group project is really the class which also isn't too bad its as difficult as your group makes it. She does have an accent but if you can focus you'll be fine only two test as well.

She is a very good teacher but can be a bit confusing. She has a strong accent that can be challenging when she lecture. The class is almost two hours long. You are going to have a group project in the beginning & present it at the end semester.  No quizzes or final but HW, 2 tests, participating, and easy in class work that you have to turn in.

Paola is a good professor. She knows the material well and covers it in a way the student can understand it. You don't need a textbook. She assigns homework and one semester long group project that she picks for you. Her exam questions can be poorly worded and confusing. If you talk to her she will always be reasonable with your problems comments.

Paola is a very nice person with a lot CS knowledge and background. She is one of the best professors in KSU. Take her and you will love the class and you will gain a lot knowledge in User Center Design. I really like taking her class.

I am also in this class right now. I don't know what the previous reviewer is smoking. Her class has had some the most vague requirements I have ever seen. The group assignments seem easy, but she will often fail you do to not meeting her expectations. These expectations are never addressed in the lectures! Easy class but you'll get nothing gained.

There were no reviews of her so even though I'm still in the class, I thought I'd share my thoughts. (I will revise upon completion of the course)  She is clear on what is expected but her expectations can be a little annoying.  Ex: You are required to "raise your hand above your head for every question no matter what" Etc...
